intro: Mesembryanthemum oubergense, commonly known as the Oujda ice plant, is a flowering plant native to Morocco. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. It produces a profusion of white or pale yellow blooms during the cooler months, making it a striking addition to rock gardens. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and drought-tolerant landscaping.
